page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The area of Bucks. covered by this Â£D-Square',touches the very edge of the new city of Milton Keynes, and extends South-Westwards following the course the River Great Ouse.It is, in the main,a rural/agricultural area which has a number of small villages in its bounderies.One of these, Deanshanger,has grown and developed an industrial facet to its employment pattern. Within the next 19 pages are articles about village life,population migration, housing styles,and some of the in churches the area.There are also details of interviews conducted with school children.A description of the community workshop at Watling Way is also given. Inevitably the pattern of people's days,and their general attitudes,are in a state of flux in this area.
